article:
The article was about the purported value of increasing "access" to college for black people so they can make as much money as white people. Increasing black people's "access to college" seems to be a positive thing, but even if it actually leads to better outcomes (which is obviously not a given), this is only going to help the (presumably small) percentage of americans who happen to be both black and college graduates. I'm not sure what factor is most responsible for black people's lower rates of college graduation (my guess would be "Their ancestors were slaves and this tends to cause a number of significant issues even several generations down the line"), but I'm 100% sure it's not "a lack of access to college" (whatever that even means).

To be completely honest it seems like a half-assed idea meant to assuage white guilt while also reassuring that white people don't have to give anything up themselves. Also, the study's authors may want to consider that saddling more Americans (black or otherwise) with crushing student debt may not be the best way to ensure the health and happiness of future generations. 

Also, increasing the percentage of college graduates probably won't help much with credential/degree inflation.
